page.title: 06TOURISM
page.content: Thornhill is set among some of the most beautiful surroundings in Nithsdale. It has a wide treelined main street and one of Scotland's finest crosses. It makes an excellent centre from which to explore the S.W. of Scotland and is within easy reach of:- Galloway; Edinburgh and Burns' Country, . Places of interest for the tourist include:- Drumlanrig Castle, Home of the Duke of Buccleuch; Durisdeer Marbles, an excellent example of Italian sculpture; Morton castle,a ruined 11thC castle connected with Wallace and Bruce; Maxwelltown House, Home of Annie Laurie; Wanlockhead mining museum and lead mine. Facilities for sport and recreation include golf, bowling, tennis, fishing, squash, woodland walks and a library. Tourist accomodation in the area is good.
